originContent: AppCUI-rs is a fast, cross-platform Rust library for building modern, text-based user interfaces (TUIs) with rich widgets, themes, and full Unicode supportâ€”an alternative to ncurses and other terminal UI frameworks.
translatedContent: AppCUI-rs æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹å¿«é€Ÿã€è·¨å¹³å°çš„ Rust å‡½å¼åº«ï¼Œç”¨æ–¼å»ºç«‹ç¾ä»£åŒ–çš„æ–‡å­—ç”¨æˆ¶ä»‹é¢ï¼ˆTUIï¼‰ï¼Œå…·æœ‰è±å¯Œçš„å…ƒä»¶ã€ä¸»é¡ŒåŠå®Œæ•´çš„ Unicode æ”¯æ´ï¼Œæ˜¯ ncurses èˆ‡å…¶ä»–çµ‚ç«¯ UI æ¡†æ¶çš„æ›¿ä»£æ–¹æ¡ˆã€‚

originContent: - [x] multiple out-of-the-box controls (buttons, labels, text boxes, check boxes, radio buttons, list views, tree views, combo boxes, date/time pickers, color pickers, tabs, accordeons, etc.). A full list of controls can be found [here](https://gdt050579.github.io/AppCUI-rs/chapter-3/stock_controls.html)

- [x] powerful layout system that allows you to position controls using absolute coordinates, relative coordinates, docking, alignment, anchors or pivot positioning (see more [here](https://gdt050579.github.io/AppCUI-rs/chapter-3/layout.html))
- [x] multi-platform support (Windows via API and virtual terminal, Linux via ncurses, MacOS via termios)
translatedContent: - [x] å¤šå¹³å°æ”¯æ´ï¼ˆWindows ç¶“ç”± API èˆ‡è™›æ“¬çµ‚ç«¯ã€Linux ç¶“ç”± ncursesã€MacOS ç¶“ç”± termiosï¼‰

originContent: - [x] multi-threading support to allow background tasks
- [x] predefined dialogs (message box, input box, color picker, save & open dialogs, folder navigator, etc)
- [x] true colors support (24 bits per pixel) for terminals that supports it.
ğŸ‘‰ **Check out the [Gallery](https://gdt050579.github.io/AppCUI-rs/gallery/screenshots.html) for full demos of all controls!**
AppCUI supports various backends based on the operating system it is being used for:
* **Windows Console** - based on Win32 low level API, design for clasical windows console
translatedContent: * **Windows Console** - åŸºæ–¼ Win32 ä½éš APIï¼Œè¨­è¨ˆç”¨æ–¼å‚³çµ± Windows ä¸»æ§å°

originContent: * **Windows VT** - based on ANSI sequances, designed for modern windows virtual terminals
translatedContent: * **Windows VT** - åŸºæ–¼ ANSI åºåˆ—ï¼Œè¨­è¨ˆç”¨æ–¼ç¾ä»£ Windows è™›æ“¬çµ‚ç«¯æ©Ÿ

originContent: * **NCurses** - based on NCurses API for linux envinronments
* **Termios** - based on ANSI sequances and low level APIs for MAC OSX
translatedContent: * **Termios** - åŸºæ–¼ ANSI åºåˆ—åŠ MAC OSX ä½éš API

originContent: * **Web Terminal** - designed for Web implementation (based on webgl)
* **CrossTerm** - based on the `crossterm` crate, but enabled via a feature flag
More on the supported backends can be found [here](https://gdt050579.github.io/AppCUI-rs/chapter-2/backends.html)

originContent: Then run the project with `cargo run`. You should see a window with the title `Test` and the text `Hello World !` in the center.
AppCUI-rs comes with a set of examples to help you get started. You can find them in the [examples](examples) folder, including:

- **Games** such as [Tic Tac Toe](examples/tic-tac-toe/), [Snake](examples/snake/), [Flappy Bird](examples/flappy), [Minesweeper](examples/minesweeper/), [Ram it](examples/ramit/), [PacMan](examples/games/), [Chees](examples/games/), [Connect Four](examples/games/), [2048](examples/games/) or [Tetris](examples/games/)

Contributions, issues, and feature requests are welcome!
